title: Firefox Monitor; Breach Resolved?
content:
A recent breach might explain why I have about 500 spam emails this month. Plus an unusual number missed by Gmail's usually pretty good filter.

The main problem is with Gravatar (www.gravatar.com), somehow associated with WordPress.com.Â ?? It doesn't seem to allow changes to either email address or password, unless I overlooked something... Options available are to Hide and/or Close the account, and I did both. Trying to sign in again still shows my email addy, so I'm not sure that it has been resolved quite yet. Oh and.. There I can change the email address, but there's no point in being spammed all over again from a different direction.

Less of a problem is the 500px site. Some nice photographs in there, but I haven't visited in years (probably). My account there has been deactivated, in the meantime, and, judging by the amount of spam until the last month or so, I'd guess that one is resolved. And, btw.. I do use unique passwords.

I'm actually very grateful for this service. I'm just not sure I managed to fix either breach. The other thing is that Gmail places the notifications under Promotions tab instead of Primary or Updates tabs. Not sure what I can do to fix that....

Many Thanks,

Colin.
creator: colincv

title: What are the EOL of Firefox 94.0.1 and 54.0.1?
content:
Hi Mozilla,

Could you please help to let us know what are the EOL of Firefox 94.0.1 and 54.0.1?

Thanks

title: Latest update cause major stuttering on launch
content:
Idk how you can help.

Every time I launch firefox there is noticeable lag and stuttering with my mouse movements and PC in general.

Before you say it's my themes/extensions/etc. this did not happen in the previous build and does not happen on my Linux version but that's still running the previous build. Other than the Firefox version, nothing has changed.

OS: Windows 10 Build 19043.1237
creator: CouchMountain

title: Disabling the automatic upadate notifications
content:
Hello,

Please inform me how to disable the automatic updates and or notifications. This intrusive feature is not in alignment with you original mission statement. Why force an update every two or three weeks?

thank you for your concern
